column1: 0,msd_servo_drive.txt,77,286662f62c9debc49f7ce2b9e1b3597470cacf18b795e3ea81e921e06106f1af,"There always remains a variation between reference and actual position. P 255[0] - MPRO_ECAM_Egear_GearInAcc is used to define the acceleration for the ""RAMP (1)” mode.
P 257[0] - MPRO_ECAM_Egear_GearInDist is used to define the engagement distance.

column5: EGEAR: GearIn - acceleration ramp for engagement
EGEAR: GearIn - acceleration ramp jerk for engagement

column1: Table 8.39: “Synchronized motion - Electronic gearing - Engagement” parameters

Disengagement with fade-out function (5th order polynomial): jerk limited. The position is ignored. There always remains a variation between reference and actual position. P 254[0] - MPRO_ECAM_Egear_GearOutMode is used to define the mode for disengagement.
Disengagement with linear deceleration: With jerking. P 256[0] (see below) is used to define the deceleration for the ""RAMP (1)” mode.
P 258[0] - MPRO_ECAM_Egear_GearOutDist is used to define the disengagement distance. The actual disengagement occurs within this range (between the dashed lines).
MOOG                       ID No.:CB40859-001 Date:11/2020                                                                                  MSD ServoDrive  - DeviceHelp    285
MOOG ID No.:CB40859-001 Date:11/2020 MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp 286

",What are the modes available for disengagement in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' manual?,"The modes are FADE (2), DIRECT (0), and RAMP (1).","Disengagement can be performed in FADE (2), DIRECT (0), or RAMP (1) modes.","In the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' manual, disengagement modes include FADE (2) for fade-out, DIRECT (0) for direct disengagement, and RAMP (1) for linear speed ramp.","Available disengagement modes are FADE (2), DIRECT (0), and RAMP (1), each serving different disengagement functions.","The manual lists three disengagement modes: FADE (2), DIRECT (0), and RAMP (1), catering to various disengagement needs."

",What actions are required to start and stop the engagement in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' manual?,Click 'Start' to begin and 'Stop' followed by 'Halt' to end engagement.,Initiate engagement with 'Start' and terminate with 'Stop' and 'Halt'.,The 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' manual instructs to use 'Start' for engagement commencement and 'Stop' plus 'Halt' for cessation.,Engagement starts with 'Start' button and stops with sequential 'Stop' and 'Halt' commands.,"To manage engagement, activate with 'Start' and deactivate by pressing 'Stop' then 'Halt'."
